text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Greek Cypriot press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Communist Akel gives lease of life to dialogue with other opposition parties to try to find candidate in presidential elections next year.
- President Clerides says he will stand in next year's presidential elections if there is progress on Cyprus issue.
- Fifty percent of youths who live in tourist areas have dabbled with narctotics at one time or another, says chief of police.
- Owner of dog that killed five-year-old boy three months ago has switched plea to guilty from not guilty.
- Police highlight growing problem of drug abuse in Cyprus.
- Cyprus's first Eurobond issue draws strong interest from international and institutional investors.
- Workers at Thank God It's Friday restaurant in Nicosia are due to end week-old strike on Wednesday.
- Parliament expected to ratify bill on Thursday regulating banking sector.
- Opposition parties will continue dialogue on finding candidate for presidential elections.
- Only basis by which Turkey is discussing a solution to Cyprus problem is formula of territory in return for recognition (of breakaway Turkish Cypriot state).
- Volume on Cyprus stock exchange goes up; it breaks through 15 percent volatility limit.

- Turkey has asked Turkish Cypriot leader Rauf Denktash to avoid any actions that might result in Turkish side being blamed for any possible failure of direct talks scheduled to begin with President Clerides on July 9.
